metadata.title: CVE-2014-8562 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
DCM decode in ImageMagick before 6.8.9-9 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (out-of-bounds read).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8562` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-2
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-2
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-2
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-2
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-2').
